Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Dear students, the poll results show that the majority voted for the time of 14:00 - 16:00 (20 votes to 15). Therefore next week the online tutorials will start at 14:15. It was the original time to begin with and I apologize that the previous time was the result of a miscommunication between me and the room booking service.  Best, Oliver

Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Dear students, some of you have expressed concern about the sudden tutorial time change which may hinder your ability to attend. For the first two live tutorials, there is no other option due to room booking restrictions. However, for the online tutorials held via Zoom, I am more flexible. A poll has been made available under the announcement folder where you can vote for your favorite time on tuesday. There will be no recordings for the tutorials, although any other notes and material will be uploaded. I will inform you about the result next week.  Best, Oliver

Discussions.Discussion_Name: First Live Lecture Tomorrow, 22.4.2024, 12:15-13:45 in H2013

Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Dear students, I'd like to urgently inform you that the starting time for the tutorial has been changed from previously 12:00 to now 14:00!!! The new time is now Tuesday 14:00-16:00 (although it formally starts at 14:15) in the same room FH 311. There are only two events in this room while others will be online. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause to your schedule. Best, Oliver

Messages.Author: Eva Böwing
Messages.Content: Hello everyone,  While watching the screencast Volatility Part 6, I had a question. At the end of the lecture, the arch_1 model and the arch_1_12 model are compared with the Akaike information criterion and the Bayesian information criterion. I remember that the model with a lower AIC or BIC value should be favoured. In this case, the arch_1_12 model has a lower AIC and BIC value, but the professor says that we prefer the arch_1 model. Can someone explain to me how this decision is reached? I would really appreciate an answer. Thank you very much and have a nice rest of the weekend everyone.

Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Hello,  you can hear the professor talking about that the larger AIC model ist worse. I think the professor simply missed the negative sign in front of the number. In reality you should choose the arch_1_12 model.  Best,  Oliver

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Screencast Part 9 Confusion about meaning of AIC and BIC

Messages.Author: Marcel Heidebrecht
Messages.Content: Hey, at the end of screencast part 9 it is said, that the AR(3) model is preferred over the more complicated models AR(5) and AR(6) due to the AIC. But isn't it the other way around? Aren't actually the lower AIC values of the AR(5) and 6 to be preferred? In general with so many observations the BIC gives an advantage to simpler models or am I mistaken? Thank you and best regards

Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Hello,  of course you are correct with your observation. We can see that the AIC value is lower for the more complicated models. However when looking at the BIC the simpler model has to be preferred. In situations where AIC and BIC do not give an exact decision one usually falls back to the simpler model. I think the professor did not see the negative sign and confused the order as a few slides before the log likelihood was in the negative.   Best Oliver

Messages.Author: Marcel Heidebrecht
Messages.Content: Thanks for clarifying that. These sign changes really can get quite confusing :D

Messages.Author: Tobias Jäger
Messages.Content: Hello Mister Hölscher, because of the close voting I wanted to ask, whether 2 tutorials can be held between 12 and 4 p.m.? Best regards, Tobias

Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Dear Tobias,  unfortunately only one tutorial will be held. However all materials you need will be uploaded and there are plenty of opportunities for self study. If you are technically well versed you may record the tutorial on your own accord for personal use only.  Best,  Oliver

Messages.Content: Hello, As the unexpected change to the tutorial time most likely affected the schedules of many of us, I wanted to make a plea for the recording of the sessions if possible, Thanks in advance for the consideration

Messages.Author: Oliver Hölscher
Messages.Content: Hello,  the first two live tutorials need to be held at the new time 14:00-16:00 due to room booking restrictions and there can't be recordings for these.  However, I am flexible in the online tutorials and can happily change the time back to 12:00 for you. There will be a poll made available.  Best,  Oliver
